1.str2: If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

1.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
1.str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The tongue; by implication, a language.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

1.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
1.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

1.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
1.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

1.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
1.str2: From echos; to make a loud noise, i.e. Reverberate.
Perhaps from chalao through the idea of hollowing out as a vessel; copper.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

1.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular
1.str2: From alale; to vociferate, i.e. to wail; figuratively, to clang.
A cymbal. From a derivative of the base of kuma; a 'cymbal'.

2.str2: If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

2.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
2.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Prophecy, prophesying; the gift of communicating and enforcing revealed truth. From prophetes; prediction.
And, even, also, namely.

2.parse: Verb - Perfect Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
2.str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From a derivative of muo; a secret or 'mystery'.
And, even, also, namely.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.
And, even, also, namely.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

2.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
2.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.
Methistano meth-is-tan'-o from meta and histemi; to transfer, i.e. Carry away, depose or exchange, seduce.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

2.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
2.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

2.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
2.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No one, none, nothing.

3.str2: If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
3.str2: To feed, dole out. From the base of psomion; to supply with bits, i.e. to nourish.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
3.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
3.str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 1st Person Singular
3.str2: To boast; I glory (exult) proudly. From some base akin to that of aucheo and euchomai; to vaunt.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
3.str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
3.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

3.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
3.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

3.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
3.str2: To help, benefit, do good, be useful (to), profit. From the same as opheleia; to be useful, i.e. To benefit.

4.str2: From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

4.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: From the same as makrothumos; to be long-spirited, i.e. forbearing or patient.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

4.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: To be kind (full of service to others), gentle. Middle voice from chrestos; to show oneself useful, i.e. Act benevolently.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

4.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: From zelos; to have warmth of feeling for or against.

4.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: To boast, vaunt myself. Middle voice from perperos; to boast.

4.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: From phusis in the primary sense of blowing; to inflate, i.e. make proud.

5.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.

5.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: To arouse anger, provoke, irritate. From para and a derivative of oxus; to sharpen alongside, i.e. to exasperate.

5.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: To reckon, count, charge with; reason, decide, conclude; think, suppose.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.

6.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Injustice, unrighteousness, hurt. From adikos; injustice; morally, wrongfulness.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

6.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: To rejoice with, congratulate. From sun and chairo; to sympathize in gladness, congratulate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

7.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
7.str2: To cover, conceal, ward off, bear with, endure patiently. From stege; to roof over, i.e. to cover with silence.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

7.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
7.str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

7.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
7.str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

7.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
7.str2: From hupo and meno; to stay under, i.e. Remain; figuratively, to undergo, i.e. Bear, have fortitude, persevere.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

8.str2: From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
Never. From oude and pote; not even at any time, i.e. Never at all.

8.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
8.str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
Prophecy, prophesying; the gift of communicating and enforcing revealed truth. From prophetes; prediction.

8.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
8.str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
The tongue; by implication, a language.

8.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
8.str2: A primary verb; to stop, i.e. Restrain, quit, desist, come to an end.

Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.

8.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
8.str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.

9.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

9.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
9.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A part, portion, share. From an obsolete but more primary form of meiromai; a division or share.

9.str2: From prophetes; to foretell events, divine, speak under inspiration, exercise the prophetic office.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A part, portion, share. From an obsolete but more primary form of meiromai; a division or share.

When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

From an obsolete particle ne- and epos; not speaking, i.e. An infant; figuratively, a simple-minded person, an immature Christian.

11.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
11.str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

From an obsolete particle ne- and epos; not speaking, i.e. An infant; figuratively, a simple-minded person, an immature Christian.

11.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular

11.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
11.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

11.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
11.str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.
From an obsolete particle ne- and epos; not speaking, i.e. An infant; figuratively, a simple-minded person, an immature Christian.

12.str2: Now, just now, at this moment. Adverb from a derivative of airo through the idea of suspension; just now.

12.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
12.str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
A riddle, an enigma. From a derivative of ainos; an obscure saying, i.e. obscureness.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A mirror, looking-glass (made of highly polished metal). From eis and a presumed derivative of optanomai; a mirror.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
Now, just now, at this moment. Adverb from a derivative of airo through the idea of suspension; just now.

12.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
12.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A part, portion, share. From an obsolete but more primary form of meiromai; a division or share.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

12.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
12.str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

12.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
12.str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.

13.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A prolonged form of nun for emphasis; just now.
Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.

13.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
13.str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
